name: TheAtlantic
text: The luxury fashion industry is built on the hierarchies of classism and racism. @amandamull explores what it would take for fashion to survive without them. https://t.co/u27gr9uY0P

name: TheAtlantic
text: Lt. Col. Alexander Vindman is retiring from the military due to the president's alleged “bullying." In February, @benjaminwittes wrote that he had been punished for “the crime of doing the right thing”: https://t.co/KCl2P21UaT

name: TheAtlantic
text: Padma Lakshmi’s “Taste the Nation” might seem at first glance like a travelogue showcasing America’s most beloved dishes. But it’s really a sharp indictment of a national cuisine based on betrayal, writes @sophieGG: https://t.co/qhCN9rdEU1

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The argument is not based on any programmatic promises or some kind of policy agenda for a second term in office," @qjurecic and @benjaminwittes write: https://t.co/rGshQvEKrx

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro has described the coronavirus as a “little flu,” accused the media of manufacturing “hysteria,” and railed against lockdowns, @UriLF reported in March.

On Tuesday, he tested positive for the coronavirus. https://t.co/FChlC4oWeF

name: TheAtlantic
text: Earth at night is a navy-blue marble with a dusting of gold, the electric sparks of modern life. When the pandemic arrived, researchers started seeing intriguing changes in the glow, @marinakoren reports: https://t.co/qUTBVBUysB

name: TheAtlantic
text: Earth at night is a navy-blue marble with a dusting of gold, the electric sparks of modern life. When the pandemic arrived, researchers started seeing intriguing changes in the glow, @marinakoren reports: https://t.co/xVJvfWGAmC

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I always feel like I'm never doing enough." America's public-health experts are tired, drained, and frustrated about shouting advice into a political void, @edyong209 reports. https://t.co/yeDtAStwLb

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The backlash against a successful government program is why the U.S. can’t have nice things." @GrahamDavidA looks at criticism of the Paycheck Protection Program: https://t.co/VpWr2GVm4e

name: TheAtlantic
text: The United States is breaking coronavirus-case records weekly. Americans should avoid faulting the wrong people, our writers warn. From @mimbsy: https://t.co/7JXbuMzgbd

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Instead of speeding forward with reopening their economies, these states should do everything in their power to make a return to school possible in the fall—especially for younger children," @SarahCohodes writes: https://t.co/v5A2GJ7wNz

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Instead of speeding forward with reopening their economies, these states should do everything in their power to make a return to school possible in the fall—especially for younger children," @SarahCohodes writes: https://t.co/lgCjr0tM36

name: TheAtlantic
text: Days of torrential rainfall in central Japan have led to extensive flooding and mudslides, leaving as many as 58 people dead so far. https://t.co/DUb0nNRFZJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Rather than thinking of abolition as just getting rid of police, I think about it as an invitation to create and support lots of different answers to the problem of harm in society," @dereckapurnell writes: https://t.co/T8Hgk81C9k

name: TheAtlantic
text: Donald Trump, the man, lost at the Supreme Court. But Donald Trump, the candidate, can claim victory. Our writers explain in the latest Atlantic Daily: https://t.co/Km5Wk7qjYa
